meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the removal of a carboxyl group from a molecule.
meanings.sent1: The decarboxylase helped in removing the carboxyl group from the molecule.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the decarboxylase to understand its role in chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The decarboxylase enzyme decided to take a break from removing carboxyl groups.
meanings.sent4: The decarboxylase worked like a tiny molecular scissors, snipping off carboxyl groups.
meanings.sent5: In the lab, the decarboxylase enzyme danced around happily after successfully decarboxylating the molecule.

meanings.definition: A substance that facilitates the decarboxylation process in organic chemistry.
meanings.sent1: The decarboxylase was added to the reaction mixture to speed up decarboxylation.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemists use decarboxylase to make certain reactions more efficient.
meanings.sent3: The decarboxylase substance whispered to the molecules, encouraging them to lose their carboxyl groups.
meanings.sent4: The decarboxylase acted like a helpful guide, leading the molecules through the decarboxylation process.
meanings.sent5: When added to the solution, the decarboxylase substance sparked a chain reaction of carboxyl group removal.
